credibility.title: Credibility Rooted in Legal Excellence
credibility.description: Our founders are recognized globally for their expertise in banking, finance, and M&A. We provide the institutional governance required to protect interests where clarity is paramount.

aiSection.headline: Secure Innovation at the Frontier of Legal Advisory

cta.title: Ready to Establish Your Latin American Presence?

header.title: Experience and Innovation
header.subtitle: About Us
header.description: Ágora Abogados combines the dynamism of a modern firm with the vast experience and leadership of our partners.

firm.title: Our Firm
firm.quote: "We provide the personalized service of a legal boutique with global reach, capabilities, and vision."
firm.description: Ágora Abogados is a law firm based in Caracas, Venezuela. We combine the dynamism and innovation of a modern firm with the vast experience and renowned leadership of our partners and team.

pillar1.title: Quality, Agility and Excellence
pillar1.desc: A team committed to delivering top-quality service to our clients and continuously improving high-performance standards.

pillar2.title: In-Depth Analysis
pillar2.desc: We are dedicated to thoroughly understanding the specific circumstances, challenges and objectives of our clients' businesses, in order to provide comprehensive legal advice.

pillar3.title: Tailored Strategies
pillar3.desc: After gaining a complete understanding of the challenges and opportunities, our innovative team will identify the best option and design customized legal strategies to achieve the best possible outcome.

pillar4.title: Agile and Precise Execution
pillar4.desc: Our team of highly recognized professionals implements solutions effectively, ensuring sustainable and long-lasting results.

value1.title: Innovation
value1.desc: We are accustomed to going beyond the conventional to develop innovative legal strategies and achieve optimal results.

value2.title: Sustainability
value2.desc: Priority on sustainable and socially responsible practices in governance and environmental matters across all operations.

value3.title: Excellence
value3.desc: Committed to continuous improvement and at the forefront of legal practices in ever-changing environments.

value4.title: Integrity
value4.desc: Highlighting ethical conduct and transparency in all interactions, fostering trust with clients and stakeholders.

value5.title: Loyalty, Trust & Collaboration
value5.desc: The pillars of our relationships. We build strong, lasting bonds based on transparency, mutual respect, and an unwavering commitment to our clients' interests.

focus1.title: Banking, Finance, Capital Markets, VC and PE
focus1.desc: Strategic legal advice to banks, brokers, and financial institutions. Expertise in international financial services, captive financing entities, and holding structures. Specialization in retail financing, consumer and automotive financing, and debtor-creditor relations.

focus2.title: Food & Agriculture
focus2.desc: Comprehensive legal support in agricultural and agro-industrial sectors. From project development and infrastructure to regulatory compliance, planting programs, and supply chain management. Designing corporate structures for regional expansion and financing.

focus3.title: Energy, Infrastructure and Environment
focus3.desc: Supporting sustainable development and project financing in the energy and infrastructure sectors, ensuring compliance and operational efficiency.

focus4.title: Healthcare & Life Sciences
focus4.desc: High-value specialized legal services in healthcare and pharmaceuticals. Focus on regulatory compliance, IP protection, distribution networks, pharmacy franchises, and specialized M&A.

focus5.title: Industrials, Manufacturing & Transportation
focus5.desc: Specialized services to transportation companies, including cable systems. Efficient structures for national market operations, addressing public law and multi-level taxation.

header.title: Join Ágora
header.subtitle: Careers
header.description: Be part of a dynamic team committed to excellence and innovative solutions in a collaborative environment.

intro.quote: "Excellence is not an act, but a habit."
intro.p1: We are seeking exceptional legal talent to join our high-performance team. As an institutional boutique, we offer the opportunity to facilitate complex cross-border transactions and strategic advisory at the highest level.
intro.p2: If you are a professional committed to legal excellence and secure innovation, we invite you to explore our current opportunities.

openings.title: Senior Associate – M&A & Private Equity
openings.description: Lead complex cross-border acquisitions and private equity transactions within a high-stakes institutional environment.
requirements: Excellence in M&A structuring and negotiation.
Deep understanding of Private Equity fund dynamics.
Proven track record in cross-border corporate reorganizations.

openings.title: Senior Associate – Banking & Finance
openings.description: Advise global financial institutions on complex regulatory frameworks, debt restructuring, and sophisticated credit facilities.
requirements: Specialized knowledge in Banking & Finance regulations.
Experience in debt restructuring and project finance.

openings.title: Senior Associate – Corporate Governance & Advisory
openings.description: Provide high-level corporate advisory and governance support to multinational entities and family offices.
requirements: Mastery of corporate law and governance standards.
Experience in complex commercial contract negotiation.
Strong leadership and project management capabilities.

success.title: Application Received

intro.quote: "Institutional excellence begins with a single conversation."
intro.description: Whether you are a private equity fund, an institutional investor, or a strategic operator, our team is ready to provide the local clarity you need.

header.title: World-Class Expertise
header.subtitle: Our People
header.description: A multidisciplinary team of strategic legal and investment specialists.

alvaro.bio: With over 30 years of legal experience, Álvaro stands as a prominent figure in Banking, Finance, and Capital Markets. His career includes a tenure as partner at Baker McKenzie. He has provided strategic counsel to both national and international financial institutions on complex regulatory matters, project financing, and high-value transactions.

maria.bio: María Eugenia brings over three decades of legal expertise, specializing in Corporate, Real Estate, Environmental, and Sustainability law. Previously a partner at Baker McKenzie, she has advised major corporations on cross-border transactions, regulatory compliance, and sustainable development initiatives across Latin America.

jose.bio: José is an expert in Taxation and M&A with over 25 years of professional experience. Licensed to practice law in both Mexico and Venezuela, he has designed and implemented complex tax structures for multinational corporations and led significant cross-border acquisitions.

ariana.bio: Ariana leads the Labor Law practice with over 10 years of specialized experience. As a member of the Venezuelan Institute of Social Law, she provides expert guidance on employment contracts, workforce restructuring, and labor litigation for diverse industries.

lizeth.bio: Lizeth, based in Aragua, is a Civil and Commercial Litigation expert with over 25 years of experience. She represents clients in complex commercial disputes, contract law, and judicial procedures, ensuring robust legal protection across various regional jurisdictions.

marco.bio: Marco specializes in Tax Law, providing strategic counsel on fiscal compliance and litigation. He has extensive experience in both administrative and judicial tax procedures, helping clients navigate complex regulatory frameworks.

barbara.bio: Bárbara focuses on Corporate Law and Intellectual Property. She advises clients on business formation, contract negotiation, and the protection of brand assets and innovative technologies.

manuel.bio: Manuel is a specialist in Labor Law and Human Resources. He assists corporations in managing employment relationships, drafting comprehensive internal policies, and ensuring compliance with labor regulations.

dayana.bio: Dayana focuses on Corporate and Commercial Law. She supports clients through the lifecycle of their business operations, from incorporation and governance to commercial agreements and dissolution.

raul.bio: Raúl is an expert in Dispute Resolution and Litigation. He represents clients in civil and commercial cases, bringing a strategic approach to conflict mediation and courtroom representation.

rodrigo.bio: Rodrigo specializes in Public Law and Regulatory Affairs. He advises on government relations, administrative procedures, and compliance with public sector regulations.

andreina.bio: Andreína focuses on International Business and Investment Law. She assists clients in cross-border trade, foreign investment regulations, and international commercial arbitration.

fabiola.bio: Fabiola is a specialist in Environmental Law and Natural Resources. She guides organizations through environmental impact assessments, regulatory compliance, and sustainable resource management.

andrea.bio: Andrea is the Business Leader at Ágora Abogados, where she leads operational strategy and business development. She leverages her background in Chemical Engineering and her ongoing MBA at IESA to optimize complex project workflows and drive organizational efficiency.

oriana.bio: Oriana serves as the Administration Manager at Ágora Abogados, bringing over 10 years of expertise in treasury and financial administration. Having previously led treasury functions at Baker McKenzie, she ensures the firm's operational backbone is defined by fiscal precision and institutional excellence.

juan.bio: Juan Francisco leads the firm's digital presence and technological integration. He focuses on leveraging digital tools to enhance client communication, operational transparency, and the overall efficiency of legal processes.

labels.noPublications: No publications listed at this time.

overview: Álvaro J. Posada Sessarego, an expert lawyer in banking, corporate finance, and capital markets, has over 30 years of experience advising multinational companies on successfully navigating the complex Venezuelan legal environment and designing strategies and structures for the expansion of local companies into other countries. He is recognized for his practicality and creativity, as well as his unique commercial approach that goes beyond strictly legal matters.

He is positioned as the trusted strategic advisor for several international business groups in handling sensitive and complex issues. His advisory expertise spans financing, acquisitions, multijurisdictional corporate reorganizations, insolvency, and debt restructuring.
experience: Álvaro is currently the Founding Partner of Ágora Abogados and leads the Banking, Finance, Capital Markets, Private Equity, and Debt Restructuring practice areas. He developed a distinguished career at the international law firm Baker McKenzie, where he held various positions:

items: Managing Partner of the Venezuela offices
Member of the Latin American Management Council
Chairman of the Latin America Banking and Finance Practice Group
Member of the Global Banking and Finance Practice Group Steering Committee
Member of Baker McKenzie’s Global Policy Committee

experience: Álvaro’s professional affiliations include his role as Vice President and later President of the Corporate Finance Committee of Venamcham (Venezuelan-American Chamber of Commerce) and other trade chambers, as well as his active participation in The American Bar Association and the New York State Bar Association. He has contributed to publications and has been a speaker and moderator at national and international events.
education: Lawyer, Universidad Católica Andrés Bello (1988)
Financial Management Programa, Instituto de Estudios Superiores de Administración (IESA) (1989)
Master in International Banking Law (LLM), Boston University (1992)
Master in comparative Jurisprudence, New York University (1993)
publications: Co-author of “Commercial Space Securization in Latin America“, Global Securization Review 2004/2005, EuroMoney Year Books, January 1, 2004
alvaro-posada.affiliations: Venezuelan-American Chamber of Commerce and Industry (Venamcham)

overview: María Eugenia Reyes, lawyer with over 30 years of experience in corporate, real estate, environmental law, and sustainability, with a strong focus on the design and implementation of asset structures, shareholder agreement negotiations, foreign investments, mergers, and acquisitions.

Throughout her professional career, she has demonstrated exceptional ability to understand clients beyond their obvious needs, diving deep into matters and successfully closing the projects and cases she has handled.
experience: María Eugenia Reyes is a Founding Partner of Ágora Abogados and leads the Mergers, Acquisitions, and Corporate Law practice areas. She had a distinguished career as a partner at Baker & McKenzie and local firms, holding leadership positions that brought her practice areas to international standards. She was also a pioneer and leader of sustainability committees.
education: Lawyer, Universidad Católica Andrés Bello, 1988
Specialization in Procedural Law, Universidad Católica Andrés Bello, 1993
publications: “Hazardous Substances, Materials and Waste Handling” Latin American Law & Business Report, No. 5, June 1, 2003
“Daños al Ambiente” El Universal, Caracas, Venezuela, February 19, 2003
“Desechos Peligrosos” El Universal, December 23, 2002
“Ley de Tierras y Desarrollo Agrario” El Universal, Caracas, Venezuela, December 26, 2001
“Environmental Policy and Law in Latin America” Baker & McKenzie, January 1, 1998
“La Ley Penal del Ambiente y las Normas Complementarias” Revista Número, March 1992 edition, September 1, 1992
“La Ley Penal del Ambiente y los Estudios de Impacto Ambiental” Revista Barriles, May 1, 1992

“El Amparo Constitutional” Revista de la Facultad de Derecho de la Universidad Católica Andrés Bello, No. 37, January 8, 1987. Awarded in the Student Competition Commemorating the 25th Anniversary of the 1961 Constitution.

overview: José P. Barnola Jr. is a lawyer with extensive experience in areas such as taxation, mergers and acquisitions, contract and corporate law, as well as serving as an arbitrator. He is licensed to practice in Mexico and Venezuela. Throughout his career of over 25 years, he has led local and regional projects across Latin America.

Additionally, he has practiced law independently in Venezuela and Mexico and has acted as an arbitrator in commercial disputes. His contributions in these fields, especially in complex tax litigation, international taxation and arbitration, have earned him recognition in various legal circles.
experience: José P.’s distinguished career is marked by his role as a professor of Tax Law for over 17 years in several universities. Currently, he serves as Practice Leader at Ágora in Mexico City and Caracas. Before joining Ágora, he held various leadership and management positions in international law firms, including:

items: Professional Development and Knowledge Management Leader
Latin America Representative on the Global Consumer Products and Retail Committee
Member of the Global Committee on Tax Dispute Resolution

education: Law Degree, Universidad Católica Andrés Bello, cum laude, 1993
Tax Law LLM, Universidad Central de Venezuela, cum laude, 2000
General Exam for the Law Degree, Centro Nacional de Evaluación para la Educación Superior (Mexico, 2020)
Law Degree Revalidation and Professional License, Secretaría de Educación Pública (Mexico, 2021)
Advanced Studies Program in Arbitration, Universidad Monteávila, 2022
publications: «Lo que no se enseña en las facultades de derecho», in FORO JURÍDICO N° 262, julio 2025, Ciudad de México

«Apuntes sobre los límites de las reorganizaciones corporativas y el arbitraje de inversión desde la perspectiva mexicana», in XX JORNADAS VENEZOLANAS DE DERECHO TRIBUTARIO 2023, Asociación Venezolana de Derecho Tributario, Caracas, 2024

«La mediación arrendaticia en el Estado de Jalisco, una nueva tendencia del mercado inmobiliario», in REVISTA PREÁMBULO N° 1, Centro de Investigación y Estudios para la Resolución de Controversias de la Universidad Monteávila (CIERC), Caracas, 2023
«Principles of investment arbitration planning in Latin America», in WORLD ARBITRATION AND MEDIATION REVIEW (WAMR+2020), Vol. 14 No. 1, Dec 31, 2022
«Comentarios al Artículo 8 de la Ley de Arbitraje Comercial Venezolana», in COMENTARIOS A LA LEY DE ARBITRAJE COMERCIAL VENEZOLANA, CIERC, with V. Falcón, Caracas, 2022

«Aspectos prácticos de la ratificación del Convenio CIADI por México, un avance alentador para los inversionistas mexicanos y extranjeros», in BOLETÍN IBEROAMERICANO DE ARBITRAJE Y MEDIACIÓN N° 1, Centro de Arbitraje de la Cámara de Caracas, Caracas, 2022
«Nuevo estudio sobre los efectos de los diseños de los sistemas tributarios en el desarrollo de Latinoamérica», bibliographic review, in TAXLATAM (https://taxlatam.com/) 13.9.22
«Aspectos prácticos de la primera audiencia de organización del procedimiento arbitral», in PRINCIPIA N° 6, CIERC, Caracas, 2022

«Principios de Planificación de Arbitraje de Inversión en Latinoamérica», trabajo ganador del premio Rodger Farrel 2021, in REVISTA DE MEDIOS ALTERNATIVOS DE RESOLUCIÓN DE CONFLICTOS, BOLETÍN ESPECIAL, Comité de Arbitraje de Venamcham and CEDCA, Caracas, 2022
jose-barnola.affiliations: Caracas Bar Association, Venezuelan Association of Procedural Law, Venezuelan Association of Tax Law, International Fiscal Association, Legal Committee of the Association of Venezuelan Businessmen in Mexico, Arbitration Center of the Caracas Chamber

overview: Ariana Cabrera Acevedo, a lawyer with more than 10 years of experience, has built a solid career in labor law. While she focuses her practice on labor law, her versatility allows her to successfully navigate other areas of law, such as civil, administrative, and regulatory compliance law.

Ariana Cabrera stands out for her legal logic, her ability to listen attentively to her clients' needs, and her skill in finding innovative solutions to their problems. Her commitment to excellence makes her an invaluable ally for those seeking high-quality legal advice.
experience: She currently serves as the Labor Law Area Leader at Ágora Abogados and also works in the areas of Administrative Law, Regulatory Law, and Compliance.
Her recent appointment as Full Member No. 12 of the Venezuelan Institute of Social Law is a clear recognition of her professional career and her commitment to defending her clients' rights.
education: Lawyer, Summa Cum Laude, Universidad Católica Andrés Bello (2014)
Advanced Studies Program in Arbitration, Universidad Monteávila (2020)
Master's in Business Management and Administration, Universidad Carlos III de Madrid (2022)
Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist, Association of Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialists (ACAMS) (2024)
Master of Laws (LLM) in Dispute Resolution, University of Missouri-Columbia (2025)
publications: "Ejecución de la sentencia: intereses de mora e indexación”, Derecho Procesal del Trabajo y Contencioso Administrativo Laboral, Ensayos, Academia de Ciencias Políticas y Sociales; Universidad Católica Andrés Bello, November 2023.
ariana-cabrera.affiliations: Full Member No. 12, Venezuelan Institute of Social Law (Interim Secretary); Member, Venezuelan Arbitration Association

overview: Lizeth Reyes holds dual degrees in Business Administration and Law, with over 25 years of professional experience in civil and commercial litigation, as well as legal advisory in judicial procedures.
Currently, she leads the Central-Western regional practice, providing strategic representation and counsel in complex legal matters across her jurisdiction.
experience: She is currently the Regional Leader of Ágora Abogados for the Central-Western region.
Lizeth has obtained specializations and master's degrees in procedural law, is a Doctor of Legal Sciences, and is currently pursuing a Higher Specialization in Immigration Law.
education: Business Administration, Universidad Bicentenaria de Aragua (1995)
Lawyer, Universidad Bicentenaria de Aragua (2015)
Specialization in Civil Procedural Law, Universidad Bicentenaria de Aragua (2017)
Master's in Civil Procedural Law, Universidad Bicentenaria de Aragua (2023)
Doctorate in Legal Sciences, Universidad Bicentenaria de Aragua (2024)
Higher Specialization in U.S. Immigration Law with special mention: Expert in U.S. Immigration and Nationality Law, Instituto Iberoamericano de Leyes y Economía [in progress]

overview: Marco Gómez is a lawyer with 6 years of experience in the corporate and financial areas. His expertise includes a deep understanding of regulatory matters, including the acquisition of securities, the marketing of new products, foreign exchange control for exports and international transactions, as well as international arbitration.

He has experience in the design, execution, and optimization of asset holding structures, processes for the acquisition and merger of companies, the formation, liquidation, and updating of companies, and the design and implementation of compliance programs and OFAC sanctions.
experience: Marco is currently an Associate at Ágora Abogados in the areas of M&A/ Corporate Law, Banking and Finance, Capital Markets, Administrative Law, Regulatory Law and Compliance, and Debt Restructuring.

Specializing in marine insurance, Marco has extensive knowledge of the maritime industry and is dedicated to continuously updating and developing his skills in this field. He is currently an Associate of the UK Association of Average Adjusters.
education: Lawyer, Universidad Católica Andrés Bello (2017)
marco-gomez.affiliations: Associate Member of the UK Association of Average Adjusters

overview: Bárbara Briceño, a lawyer with more than 8 years of experience, has developed her career in corporate law, international taxation, estate planning, and regulatory compliance.

Bárbara stands out for her attention to detail and her ability to coordinate complex projects with precision and commitment. She also excels at managing client relationships and building long-lasting bonds of trust.
experience: Her professional path has allowed her to support the structuring and administration of trusts, private foundations, and offshore companies, as well as corporate governance and due diligence processes across multiple jurisdictions.

She currently continues to expand her expertise in international tax advisory and wealth planning, working in close collaboration with partners and multidisciplinary teams to deliver efficient legal and organizational solutions.
education: Lawyer, Universidad Católica Andrés Bello, Caracas (2016)
Diploma in International Taxation, Universidad de Montevideo (2017)
Diploma in International Taxation, Universidad Católica Andrés Bello, Caracas (2022)
Diploma in Estate Planning and International Taxation, Universidad del CEMA, Buenos Aires (2023)
barbara-briceno.affiliations: Anti-Money Laundering Regime in Uruguay, CADE (2018); Introduction to American Law, University of Pennsylvania (Coursera, 2021)

overview: Manuel Domingo is a lawyer with experience in mergers and acquisitions. His fluency in English, German, and French enables him to navigate cross-border transactions with ease.

Demonstrating his commitment to continuous learning, Manuel is currently pursuing an MBA at IESA. This pursuit of business knowledge, combined with his legal acumen, positions him for exceptional success in the ever-evolving business landscape.
experience: Manuel is currently an Associate at Ágora Abogados, working in the areas of M&A/ Corporate Law, Banking and Finance and Capital Markets.
education: Lawyer, Universidad Católica Andrés Bello (2022)
Exchange Program, Universität St. Gallen (HSG) (2021)
MBA, Instituto de Estudios Superiores de Administración (IESA) (2025)

overview: Dayana Véliz is a distinguished lawyer who combines skills in law and finance to offer comprehensive solutions in the corporate sphere, including mergers and acquisitions, the design and optimization of asset-holding structures, shareholder agreements, entity incorporation, and foreign investment management.

With a degree in Law and a Master’s in Finance, Dayana is positioned as a key expert in corporate law in Venezuela. Her ability to understand and apply complex legal issues to financial contexts makes her an invaluable resource for her clients.
experience: Dayana is currently an Associate at Ágora Abogados, working in the areas of M&A/ Corporate Law, Banking and Finance and Capital Markets.
education: Lawyer, Universidad Católica Andrés Bello (2022)
Master’s in Finance, Instituto de Estudios Superiores de Administración (IESA) (2023)
Exchange Program, COPPEAD Graduate School of Business, Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (2023)

overview: Raúl Eduardo Sancristobal is a lawyer with experience advising on complex financial disputes, matters involving cross-border securities, custodian liability, and capital markets regulation.
His meticulous approach and ability to provide innovative legal solutions distinguish him as a versatile and highly competent professional in the financial sector.
experience: Raúl is currently an Associate at Ágora Abogados, specializing in the areas of Banking, Finance, and Capital Markets.
education: Lawyer, Universidad Católica Andrés Bello (2022)

overview: Rodrigo Colmenares is a lawyer with experience in commercial law, complex litigation, and the application of emerging technologies in the legal field.

His strong background in commercial law and his interest in the impact of technology position him as a versatile professional, well-equipped to face contemporary legal challenges, including areas such as Fintech, Blockchain, and Smart Contracts.
experience: He is currently an Associate at Ágora Abogados, working in the areas of Banking, Finance, and Capital Markets.
education: Specialization in Commercial Law, Universidad Católica Andrés Bello (2025)
Advanced Diploma in Entrepreneurship and Business Management, Universidad Metropolitana (2022)
Lawyer, Universidad Metropolitana (2022)
publications: Compatibility of Smart Contracts with the Venezuelan Legal Framework (Honorable Mention and Publication). Universidad Metropolitana (2021)
rodrigo-colmenares.affiliations: Student Representative – Board of Directors, Asociación Venezolana de Arbitraje

overview: Andreina Flores is a practicing lawyer with 9 years of experience in the areas of civil, commercial, real estate, family, and inheritance law.

Andreina is complementing her academic background by pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Psychology at Universidad Bicentenaria de Aragua, with the goal of integrating a more human and multidisciplinary perspective into her legal practice.
experience: She currently works as an associate at Ágora Abogados in the area of Corporate Law.
education: Lawyer, Universidad de Carabobo (2015)
Bachelor's Degree in Psychology, Universidad Bicentenaria de Aragua [in progress]

overview: Fabiola Flores Reyes is a lawyer with 9 years of experience in the areas of civil, commercial, real estate, family, and inheritance law.

With a solid track record in advising and representing clients, Fabiola focuses on providing practical and effective legal solutions that meet the current demands of the market. Her personalized approach and ability to anticipate legal challenges make her a strategic ally for companies and individuals seeking reliable and efficient results.
experience: Currently, Fabiola works as an associate at Ágora Abogados in the area of Corporate Law.
education: Lawyer, Universidad de Carabobo (2015)

overview: Andrea Regalado is the Business Leader at Ágora Abogados, bringing a unique analytical perspective to the firm's operational management. With a background in Chemical Engineering and advanced studies in business, she specializes in bridging the gap between technical precision and organizational strategy.

Throughout her career, she has demonstrated a strong capability for process optimization and data-driven decision-making. Her focus is on implementing institutional-grade operational frameworks that ensure the firm's growth is supported by efficient workflows and robust management systems.
experience: Andrea serves as the Business Leader at Ágora Abogados, where she leads the design and execution of operational strategies. Her multidisciplinary approach integrates engineering principles with business management to optimize complex project lifecycles and enhance client service delivery.

Her professional trajectory includes significant experience in demand planning and procurement within the logistics and pharmaceutical sectors. This background, coupled with her ongoing MBA at IESA, allows her to manage the firm's internal infrastructure with a focus on scalability, transparency, and high-performance standards.
education: Chemical Engineering, Universidad Metropolitana (2021)
MBA, Instituto de Estudios Superiores de Administración (IESA) [2025]

overview: Oriana Rodríguez is the Administration Manager at Ágora Abogados, with over a decade of specialized experience in financial administration and treasury management. Her career is built on a foundation of rigorous fiscal control and organizational excellence, having led administrative functions across diverse sectors.

With a significant tenure at international legal institutions like Baker McKenzie, she brings a high-level perspective to cash flow management, procurement, and institutional governance. Oriana's expertise ensures that the firm's administrative infrastructure operates with the precision and transparency required by a premier legal boutique.
experience: As Administration Manager, Oriana oversees the firm's financial operations, including cash flow control, treasury, and administrative organization. She is responsible for optimizing internal workflows and managing the logistical complexities of a high-growth professional services firm.

Her professional background includes senior treasury and accounts payable roles at global law firms and industrial groups. This extensive experience in managing complex fiscal schedules and administrative reporting allows her to deliver the institutional stability and operational integrity baseline upon which Ágora’s legal practices depend.
education: Higher University Technician in Business Administration, Instituto Universitario de Tecnología de Administración Industrial (2011)

overview: Juan Posada leverages a unique blend of business acumen and data-driven insights to optimize financial performance and operational efficiency at Àgora Abogados.

Drawing from a strong background in Business Management and Data Analytics, Juan delivers solutions that empower the firm's leadership with strategic insights. He focuses on designing and implementing analytical tools that modernize legacy processes and streamline financial workflows, enabling the firm to make more informed decisions and realize tangible value.
Juan is currently advancing his capabilities by pursuing a master’s degree in Finance at IESA, further strengthening his commitment to driving the firm's growth and success.
experience: He specializes in Financial Performance and Operational Efficiency at Ágora Abogados.
education: Bachelor of Science in Business Management, Minor in Business Analytics, Concentration in Entrepreneurship. Wentworth Institute of Technology (2024)
Master in Finance Candidate, Instituto de Estudios Superiores de Administración [in progress]

header.title: Practice Areas
header.subtitle: Our Services
header.description: Strategically advising national and multinational companies on a global scale.

m-and-a.title: Corporate and M&A
m-and-a.desc: Comprehensive advice to national and international clients on global corporate reorganizations, mergers, acquisitions, and joint ventures.
m-and-a.fullContent: Our Corporate and Mergers & Acquisitions team stands out for providing comprehensive key advice to both national and international clients on global corporate reorganizations, mergers, acquisitions, and joint ventures. With extensive industry experience and a commitment to personalized solutions, we guide our clients through every stage of their transactions, from due diligence and negotiation to post-closing integration, helping them achieve growth and success. Our expertise has positioned our team as strategic key advisors for those undertaking corporate reorganizations, optimizing corporate governance and aligning stakeholders across multiple jurisdictions in the most comprehensive, efficient, and agile manner. Our team has an outstanding track record of assisting local companies in their international expansion, as well as helping foreign companies establish themselves in our region.

banking.title: Banking & Finance
banking.desc: Strategic legal counsel to banks in regulatory matters, financial products, lending, and extensions of credit.
banking.fullContent: We provide strategic legal counsel to banks in regulatory, as well as in financial products, lending, and other extensions of credit. Our B&F team has developed a wide range of highly sophisticated finance, treasury, and foreign exchange products tailored to specific client objectives and has extensive experience in cross-border financial services, particularly with foreign banks providing such services to clients in the region. Our team has a strong, successful, and proven record in retail finance, automobile finance and specialty retail, such as in agricultural inputs and sowing programs.

capital-markets.title: Capital Markets
capital-markets.desc: Advisory services in capital markets transactions, assisting clients with securities issuances and key financial operations.
capital-markets.fullContent: We provide advisory services in capital markets transactions, assisting our clients with securities issuances and key financial operations to support their growth plans and structural financial changes, including capital strategies and debt issuance. We tailor our solutions to private equity scenarios, managing fund formation, overseeing transactions, and offering strategic guidance on investments, ensuring that our clients are well-positioned to capitalize on market opportunities and achieve substantial growth.

tax.title: Tax
tax.desc: Specialized advice in tax planning, compliance, litigation, and transfer pricing both in Venezuela and abroad.
tax.fullContent: Our Tax Practice specializes in providing high-value strategic advice in tax planning, compliance, tax litigation, and transfer pricing. With a focus on minimizing the legal and economic risks of operating both in Venezuela and abroad, we offer comprehensive services in areas such as customs, international trade, double taxation, tax benefits, project financing, mergers and acquisitions, among others. Our team also provides support in tax compliance, tax recoveries, and assistance with audits. In litigation matters, we represent our clients in tax and transfer pricing disputes, both in administrative and judicial proceedings, ensuring a strong and effective defense.

labor.title: Labor and Employment
labor.desc: Expert guidance on individual and collective labor law, contracts, employee benefits, and work visas.
labor.fullContent: Our team is renowned for offering expert guidance on a wide range of labor matters. From individual to collective labor law issues, we provide comprehensive assistance in areas such as labor contracts and agreements of all types, negotiation, employee benefits planning, downsizing, analysis, and recommendations on labor law compliance, administrative and judicial processes, as well as handling work visas for employees. We ensure full compliance with local labor laws while minimizing risks. With a practical approach and customized solutions tailored to each client, industry, and type of workforce, we help companies manage their labor force efficiently, optimize processes, and achieve their strategic operational goals.

regulatory.title: Regulatory Law and Compliance
regulatory.desc: Support in navigating local and international regulatory frameworks, AML, and economic sanctions.
regulatory.fullContent: We guide and support our clients in navigating the complexities of local and international regulatory frameworks. We assist companies in developing and implementing compliance programs, ensuring adherence to industry-specific regulations, government policies, and legal standards. From risk assessments and regulatory filings to internal audits, our team helps mitigate regulatory risks and maintain operational integrity in an ever-evolving environment. Our professionals hold international certifications in compliance and anti-money laundering, and have advised clients on counterpart verification and Due Diligence. Additionally, we provide counsel on economic sanctions regimes and facilitate the selection and interaction with foreign legal experts when our clients require foreign law opinions and/or coordination of consultations or license requests under specific economic sanctions regimes.

debt-restructuring.title: Debt Restructuring
debt-restructuring.desc: Strategic advice on restructuring financial obligations and navigating insolvency processes.
debt-restructuring.fullContent: Our Debt Restructuring practice provides strategic advice to companies seeking to reorganize their financial obligations. We guide clients through complex restructuring processes, helping them negotiate with creditors, optimize their capital structure, and navigate local and international insolvency frameworks to ensure business continuity and financial stability.

natural-resources.title: Natural Resources, Mining & Hydrocarbons
natural-resources.desc: Advisory on regulatory, tax, transactional, and contractual matters across the natural resources sector.
natural-resources.fullContent: Advisory on regulatory, tax, transactional, and contractual matters across the natural resources sector, including mining, hydrocarbons, and energy-related industries. The firm supports local and multinational clients in structuring, financing, and operating complex projects within highly regulated environments.

step1.title: Assessment
step1.desc: Rigorous evaluation of the market and legal landscape.

step2.title: Structuring
step2.desc: Designing a robust institutional vehicle for the objective.

step3.title: Execution
step3.desc: Local operational management and advisory support.

hero.title: Banking & Finance
hero.subtitle: Financial Infrastructure Counsel
hero.description: Legal advisory for financial institutions, corporate borrowers, and institutional investors across complex banking transactions in Latin America.

intro.lead: Ágora Abogados advises financial institutions, corporate borrowers, and institutional investors on the full spectrum of banking and finance transactions across Latin America. Our practice integrates deep regulatory knowledge with sophisticated transactional execution, enabling clients to structure, negotiate, and close complex financings in jurisdictions where legal precision is non-negotiable.
intro.body: We serve as financial infrastructure counsel—providing the regulatory certainty and deal-execution discipline that commercial banks, private credit funds, multilateral lenders, and treasury-level corporates require. From syndicated lending to distressed restructuring, our team delivers the technical depth and commercial pragmatism that move transactions forward.

practice.title: Our Banking & Finance Practice
practice.paragraph1: Ágora's Banking & Finance practice operates at the intersection of regulatory compliance and transaction execution. We advise lenders, borrowers, and financial intermediaries on matters that demand both local regulatory depth and alignment with international transaction standards.

definition.title: What is Banking Law?
definition.content: Banking law encompasses the legal framework governing financial institutions, lending relationships, prudential regulation, and the structuring of debt instruments. It requires fluency in central bank supervision, capital adequacy standards, and the contractual architectures that underpin credit markets.

practice.paragraph2: We do not approach financings as isolated documentation exercises. Every transaction is evaluated through the lens of regulatory risk, balance-sheet impact, and enforcement certainty. This integrated methodology ensures that our clients' financing structures are defensible, efficient, and aligned with institutional governance requirements.

lending.title: Corporate & Commercial Lending
lending.description: We advise on bilateral, club, and syndicated loan facilities for corporate borrowers and financial sponsors. Our team structures credit agreements, security packages, and intercreditor arrangements that satisfy both local regulatory requirements and international lender expectations.

project-finance.title: Structured & Project Finance
project-finance.description: Complex financings require bespoke legal architecture. We handle project finance for energy, infrastructure, and natural resources transactions, structuring security trusts, reserve accounts, and step-in rights that allocate risk across project lifecycles.

trade-finance.title: Trade & Commodity Finance
trade-finance.description: Our practice covers letters of credit, commodity-linked facilities, and structured trade finance products. We advise on documentary credit structures, warehouse financing, and pre-export facilities with particular focus on agricultural and extractive commodities.

regulatory.title: Regulatory Advisory & Licensing
regulatory.description: We guide financial institutions through licensing, supervisory compliance, and regulatory approvals before SUDEBAN and the Central Bank of Venezuela. Our regulatory practice extends to coordinating cross-border authorization requirements.

financial-products.title: Financial Products & Instruments
financial-products.description: We structure derivatives, guarantees, and hedging arrangements for corporate treasuries and financial institutions. Our documentation aligns with ISDA standards while addressing local enforceability and netting considerations.

cross-border.title: Cross-Border Financing
cross-border.description: Multi-jurisdictional transactions require seamless coordination. We advise on offshore structures, foreign law-governed facilities, and credit support mechanisms that bridge Venezuelan counterparties with international capital markets.

restructuring.title: Credit Restructuring & Distressed Finance
restructuring.description: When financings encounter stress, we advise lenders and borrowers on workouts, standstill arrangements, and debt-for-equity conversions. Our restructuring work integrates regulatory constraints with commercial recovery objectives.

compliance.title: Compliance & Prudential Regulation
compliance.description: We counsel financial institutions on capital adequacy, anti-money laundering frameworks, and ongoing supervisory obligations. Our compliance advisory ensures that institutional clients maintain regulatory standing.

value.title: How We Add Value
value.subtitle: We deliver value through a framework anchored in four disciplines.

regulatory-certainty.title: Regulatory Certainty
regulatory-certainty.description: Every financing structure begins with a clear understanding of applicable supervisory requirements. We identify regulatory constraints early, enabling clients to structure transactions that will withstand central bank scrutiny.

risk-allocation.title: Risk Allocation
risk-allocation.description: Banking transactions distribute risk across multiple parties. We draft documentation that precisely allocates credit risk, operational risk, and enforcement risk—ensuring that clients understand their exposure before execution.

execution-discipline.title: Execution Discipline
execution-discipline.description: Financings operate on commercial timelines. Our transaction management integrates legal workstreams with closing mechanics, reducing execution risk and ensuring that conditions precedent are satisfied efficiently.

cross-border-coordination.title: Cross-Border Coordination
cross-border-coordination.description: International financings require local counsel who understand how Venezuelan law interacts with foreign governing law, offshore security structures, and international arbitration frameworks. We bridge that gap.

syndicated-facility.title: Syndicated Credit Facility
syndicated-facility.description: Counsel to a consortium of regional banks on a multi-tranche syndicated facility for a major industrial group, including security over real property and receivables.

trade-finance-program.title: Trade Finance Program
trade-finance-program.description: Structuring and documentation of a commodity-linked revolving facility for an agricultural exporter, with letter of credit support from international confirming banks.

project-finance-energy.title: Project Finance (Energy)
project-finance-energy.description: Legal structuring for the financing of a power generation project, including security trusts, sponsor support arrangements, and step-in rights for senior lenders.

distressed-restructuring.title: Distressed Debt Restructuring
distressed-restructuring.description: Representation of a financial institution in the restructuring of a non-performing loan portfolio, including debt-for-equity conversion and regulatory approval processes.

cross-border-lending.title: Cross-Border Lending
cross-border-lending.description: Advising an international lender on the extension of credit to a Venezuelan corporate borrower under a New York law-governed facility with local security.

alvaro.name: Álvaro J. Posada Sessarego
alvaro.focus: Strategic direction for cross-border financings and capital markets transactions

marco.name: Marco Gómez
marco.focus: Regulatory compliance and structured products documentation

raul.name: Raúl Eduardo Sancristobal
raul.focus: Financial disputes and capital markets regulation

0.question: What types of financing transactions does Ágora handle?
0.answer: We advise on syndicated and bilateral lending, trade and commodity finance, project finance, structured products, and credit restructuring. Our practice covers both domestic Venezuelan transactions and cross-border financings with international counterparties.

1.question: How does Ágora address regulatory requirements in banking transactions?
1.answer: Every transaction begins with regulatory due diligence. We assess SUDEBAN and Central Bank requirements, coordinate necessary approvals, and structure documentation to ensure ongoing compliance with prudential standards.

2.question: Can Ágora advise on cross-border financings governed by foreign law?
2.answer: Yes. We regularly advise on transactions governed by New York or English law, coordinating with foreign counsel on documentation while addressing Venezuelan law aspects including local security, enforceability opinions, and regulatory considerations.

3.question: What is the difference between syndicated lending and bilateral lending?
3.answer: Bilateral lending involves a single lender and borrower. Syndicated lending involves multiple lenders participating in a single credit facility under unified documentation, typically with an agent bank coordinating the lender group.

4.question: Does Ágora advise on distressed debt and restructuring?
4.answer: We advise both lenders and borrowers on non-performing loans, workout negotiations, standstill agreements, debt-for-equity conversions, and formal restructuring processes within Venezuela's regulatory framework.

cta.title: Engage With Our Practice
cta.description: For matters involving banking transactions, financial regulation, or structured finance, we invite you to engage directly with our practice.

hero.title: Corporate & M&A
hero.subtitle: Transactional Excellence for Strategic Growth
hero.description: Cross-border M&A, joint ventures, and corporate advisory for strategic corporates, family offices, and multinationals across Latin America.

intro.lead: Ágora Abogados advises on complex corporate transactions that define market positions and enable strategic growth. Our practice serves principals who demand rigorous execution, commercial judgment, and cross-border capability.
intro.body: We function as transaction counsel for acquisitions, divestitures, joint ventures, and corporate restructurings across Latin America. Our team combines technical precision with the commercial understanding necessary to close deals in challenging regulatory environments.

practice.title: Our Corporate & M&A Practice
practice.paragraph1: Ágora's Corporate & M&A practice operates at the intersection of strategic advisory and legal execution. We advise buyers, sellers, and investors on transactions that require both local expertise and alignment with international deal standards.

definition1.title: What is M&A Law?
definition1.content: M&A law encompasses the legal framework governing acquisitions, mergers, divestitures, and corporate combinations. It requires fluency in corporate governance, securities regulation, tax structuring, and the contractual architectures that allocate risk between transaction parties.

practice.paragraph2: We approach every transaction with a focus on deal certainty. Our methodology integrates legal due diligence, regulatory analysis, and commercial negotiation into a unified execution framework. This ensures that our clients' strategic objectives are protected throughout the transaction lifecycle.

definition2.title: What is Corporate Law?
definition2.content: Corporate law governs the formation, governance, and operation of business entities. It encompasses shareholder rights, board duties, capital structures, and the regulatory frameworks that define how companies operate, transact, and interact with stakeholders.

practice.paragraph3: Our corporate practice extends beyond transactions to ongoing governance advisory. We counsel boards, shareholders, and management teams on fiduciary duties, shareholder disputes, and the structural decisions that shape long-term corporate strategy.

definition3.title: What is a Joint Venture?
definition3.content: A joint venture is a contractual or structural arrangement between two or more parties to pursue a specific business objective while maintaining separate legal identities. JV structures require careful attention to governance, profit sharing, exit mechanisms, and dispute resolution.

buy-side.title: Buy-Side M&A
buy-side.description: We represent strategic and financial buyers in acquisitions across sectors. Our team manages due diligence, structures purchase agreements, and negotiates representations, warranties, and indemnification frameworks that protect buyer interests.

sell-side.title: Sell-Side M&A
sell-side.description: We advise sellers on divestitures, management buyouts, and competitive sale processes. Our sell-side practice focuses on maximizing value, managing disclosure, and structuring transactions that achieve seller objectives.

joint-ventures.title: Joint Ventures & Strategic Alliances
joint-ventures.description: We structure joint ventures and strategic partnerships that align incentives, define governance, and establish clear exit mechanisms. Our JV practice spans greenfield projects, contribution agreements, and operational partnerships.

restructurings.title: Corporate Restructurings
restructurings.description: We advise on mergers, spin-offs, and corporate reorganizations that optimize structure for operational, tax, or regulatory objectives. Our restructuring work integrates corporate, tax, and regulatory considerations.

minority-investments.title: Minority Investments
minority-investments.description: We represent investors taking minority positions in operating companies. Our practice covers equity structures, shareholder agreements, board representation, information rights, and protective provisions.

cross-border.title: Cross-Border Transactions
cross-border.description: Multi-jurisdictional transactions require coordinated execution. We advise on transactions involving Venezuelan and Latin American targets with international buyers, sellers, or capital structures.

governance.title: Corporate Governance
governance.description: We counsel boards and shareholders on governance frameworks, fiduciary duties, and structural decisions. Our governance practice covers board composition, committee structures, shareholder rights, and executive arrangements.

due-diligence.title: Due Diligence & Risk Assessment
due-diligence.description: We lead legal due diligence processes for buyers and investors. Our due diligence teams identify material risks, assess regulatory exposures, and provide the analysis necessary for informed transaction decisions.

value.title: How We Add Value
value.subtitle: We deliver value through a framework anchored in four disciplines.

cross-border-execution.title: Cross-Border Execution
cross-border-execution.description: Transactions involving Latin American targets require counsel who understand how local law interacts with international deal structures, foreign governing law, and offshore holding arrangements. We bridge that gap.

technical-rigor.title: Technical Rigor
technical-rigor.description: Complex transactions demand precision. We draft and negotiate transaction documents that allocate risk clearly, address regulatory requirements, and anticipate post-closing contingencies.

commercial-alignment.title: Commercial Alignment
commercial-alignment.description: Legal advice must serve commercial objectives. We integrate legal strategy with deal economics, helping clients understand trade-offs and make informed decisions throughout the transaction.

governance-focus.title: Governance Focus
governance-focus.description: Transactions create governance structures that persist. We ensure that post-closing governance arrangements serve our clients' long-term interests and provide appropriate control and protection.

strategic-acquisition.title: Strategic Acquisition
strategic-acquisition.description: Counsel to a multinational industrial group on the acquisition of a Venezuelan manufacturing company, including regulatory approvals, labor transition, and post-closing integration.

cross-border-jv.title: Cross-Border Joint Venture
cross-border-jv.description: Structuring and documentation of a joint venture between a Latin American operator and an international strategic partner for a regional infrastructure project.

corporate-restructuring.title: Corporate Restructuring
corporate-restructuring.description: Multi-jurisdictional corporate reorganization for a family-owned conglomerate, optimizing holding structure for succession planning and operational efficiency.

minority-stake.title: Minority Investment
minority-stake.description: Representation of private equity investor in connection with minority equity investment in a regional services company, including governance rights and exit mechanisms.

multinational-exit.title: Multinational Exit
multinational-exit.description: Sell-side representation of an international company exiting its Venezuelan operations, including employee transition, asset disposition, and regulatory compliance.

alvaro.name: Álvaro J. Posada Sessarego
alvaro.focus: Cross-border M&A, corporate finance, and capital markets

maria.name: María Eugenia Reyes
maria.focus: Corporate restructurings, real estate transactions, and environmental compliance

marco.name: Marco Gómez
marco.focus: M&A execution, corporate governance, and regulatory compliance

barbara.name: Bárbara Briceño
barbara.focus: Corporate law, international taxation, and estate planning

manuel.name: Manuel Domingo
manuel.focus: M&A transactions, banking and finance, and capital markets

dayana.name: Dayana Véliz
dayana.focus: Corporate transactions, mergers and acquisitions, and banking

rodrigo.name: Rodrigo Colmenares
rodrigo.focus: Commercial law, fintech, and emerging technologies

0.question: What types of M&A transactions does Ágora handle?
0.answer: We advise on acquisitions, divestitures, mergers, joint ventures, minority investments, and corporate restructurings. Our practice covers both domestic Venezuelan transactions and cross-border deals with international parties.

1.question: How does Ágora approach cross-border transactions?
1.answer: Cross-border transactions require coordination between local and international legal frameworks. We work with clients' international counsel to ensure Venezuelan law aspects are addressed while maintaining alignment with the overall transaction structure.

2.question: What industries does the Corporate & M&A practice serve?
2.answer: We advise clients across sectors including manufacturing, consumer products, financial services, energy, infrastructure, technology, and professional services. Our experience spans both regulated and unregulated industries.

3.question: How long does a typical M&A transaction take?
3.answer: Transaction timelines vary based on complexity, regulatory requirements, and negotiation dynamics. Simple transactions may close in weeks, while complex cross-border deals may require several months. We work with clients to establish realistic timelines at the outset.

4.question: Does Ágora provide ongoing corporate governance support?
4.answer: Yes. Beyond transactions, we advise boards, shareholders, and management on governance frameworks, fiduciary duties, shareholder matters, and structural decisions. Many clients retain us for ongoing corporate support.

5.question: Can Ágora assist with due diligence for acquisitions?
5.answer: We lead comprehensive legal due diligence processes for buyers and investors. Our due diligence teams assess corporate, contractual, regulatory, labor, and litigation exposures to inform transaction decisions and negotiations.

cta.title: Engage With Our Practice
cta.description: For matters involving corporate transactions, M&A, or governance advisory, we invite you to engage directly with our practice.
